timeline.bodyText: This message should still say ReadsDataSource, as the actual implementation in use by the engine may vary in the future.
timeline.author: droazen

timeline.bodyText: Use the interface as the declared type wherever possible, here and below, except in cases such as ReadsPathDataSourceUnitTest where we genuinely want to restrict the implementation. This will help test whether your interface has captured sufficient functionality to be usable in practice.
timeline.author: droazen

replies.bodyText: I opted to leave the type the same in the tests, but I'm happy change to the interface.
replies.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: You have introduced your famous (unbalanced parens ) in the ReadsPathDataSource constructors -- can you fix this?
timeline.author: droazen

timeline.bodyText: The way you've structured this PR causes the commit history for ReadsDataSource to be lost/obfuscated (I checked just now in an IDE), which we should avoid if possible. I think we can help git understand what's happening by using a different name for the interface in this PR, merge it, then open a second PR to rename the interface to ReadsDataSource.
timeline.author: droazen

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it's a bit weird, git initially understood that it was a rename, but then it passed some % change threshold and it got confused.  I can do it in 2 steps if you want or just 2 commits.
replies.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: I think it has to be two PRs unfortunately, as with two commits I think it'd just get confused again after the squash. If you keep the rename of ReadsDataSource -> ReadsPathDataSource in this PR, but name the interface something like ReadsDataSourceInterface temporarily git should be able to follow the changes (but you should test this). If it works, we can do a second PR to rename the interface after this is merged.
replies.author: droazen

replies.bodyText: We can just not squash them on merge.
replies.author: lbergelson

timeline.bodyText: There are a few additional methods that I think belong in the interface: traversalIsBounded(), and indicesAvailable() (though we may want to rename the latter to something like isQueryableByInterval())
timeline.author: droazen

replies.bodyText: Neither of those are used outside of the class and it's unit tests so I left them out.  We could add an isQueryable.
replies.author: lbergelson

replies.bodyText: They complement the existing interface methods like setTraversalBounds(), query() (which throws if ! indicesAvailable()), which is why I think they belong up in the interface.
replies.author: droazen

replies.bodyText: I pulled up traversalIsBounded and added a new isQueryableByInterval
replies.author: lbergelson

timeline.message:
Extracting a new ReadsDataSource interface

* Extracting a new interface from the existing class ReadsDataSource
   * the new interface is called ReadsDataSource
   * ReadsDataSource has been renamed to ReadsPathDataSource
* This is to support the introduction of a new ReadsDataSource implementation using Htsget
